direction.raw_text: Warp Seven.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plotted and laid in, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Engage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You better believe you're engaged! Meanwhile, Geordi and Data remain at the Engineering Station, studying the displays.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think, Data, a long- lost relative? Data doesn't respond, but the curiosity on his face is apparent. EXT.  ENTERPRISE - OVER KOLARUS III - SPACE The Enterprise is in orbit around the uncharted planet.  In the distance we can see the distorting violence of an ion storm. INT.  ENTERPRISE - BRIDGE Kolarus III is on the viewscreen, the ion storm raging beyond it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I read six distinct positronic signatures, spread out over a few kilometers on the surface.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do we know about the population?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isolated pockets of humanoids.  It appears to be a pre-warp civilization at an early stage of industrial development.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain, I don't recommend transporting, that ion storm doesn't look very neighborly.  It could head this way without much warning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Understood.  Data, Worf, you're with me. Picard, Data and Worf start heading toward the turbolift.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (stands, protesting) Captain, I hope I don't have to remind you -- PICARD I appreciate your concern, Number One, but I've been itching to try out the Argo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir -- PICARD Captain's prerogative, Will. There's no foreseeable danger... and your wife would never forgive me if anything happened to you. He steps into the turbolift with the Data and Worf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have the bridge, Mister Troi! The turbolift doors slide shut. The bridge crew heartily enjoys Riker's momentary demotion to house husband. EXT.  ENTERPRISE - OVER KOLARUS III - DAY The shuttlebay doors slide open and the transport vehicle Argo emerges. The Argo is larger than a regular shuttle with a particularly large cargo area at the back. EXT.  KOLARUS III - DAY The Argo lands on the planet.  It is primarily a desert environment with some canyons and mountains.  Like Death Valley, blazing heat waves shimmer in the distance.  The shuttle sits silently for a moment.  We wonder at the delay, then... The rear cargo doors slide open and Picard, Data and Worf roar out on a 24th Century equivalent of a military jeep! Picard drives, Data beside him.  Worf stands in the back at a mounted phaser canon.  It is a muscular, exciting vehicle; a Starfleet version of the jeep from old television series "The Rat Patrol." Picard screeches to a stop.  Data and Worf lurch.  A cloud of dust momentarily obscures them.  Data quickly monitors the positronic signatures with a tricorder:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The closest signature is two kilometers to the west... that direction, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Data. (he smiles) Let's see what she can do. He roars off in a cloud of dust! Picard clearly enjoys driving.  He roars over the desert terrain at breakneck speed, having a hell of a good time. His comrades don't exactly appreciate his free-spirited driving panache. Worf clings on to the mounted phaser canon for dear life. Data steadies himself by grasping onto the rollbar
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will always be baffled by the human predilection for piloting vehicles at unsafe velocities. Picard smiles and drives a little faster.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (monitoring with tricorder) Over that rise, sir... half a kilometer. They continue on.  Before long they can see something on the level desert floor before them.  They approach and stop to discover... An android arm.  The fingers patiently drumming the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It appears to be... (he scans with his tricorder) ... an arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (suspicious) Why is it moving?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like me, it has been designed with modular power sources.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mister Worf, if you please. Worf climbs from the jeep and carefully approaches the arm. Gingerly picks it up.  The arm responds to being picked up, the hand starts feeling around in the air like something from a horror movie.  Worf shudders. He returns to the jeep.  Quickly sets the arm down in the rear cargo area.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The next signature is one kilometer to the south. Picard starts the jeep in motion. Time passes as they continue on... coming across another arm... a leg... a torso... another leg... various disassembled components of a Data-like android! EXT.  JEEP - KOLARUS III - CANYON - DAY Worf stands uneasily amidst the moving body parts.  There is only one component missing: the head.  Picard steers the jeep into a canyon.  Stops.  Data scans with his tricorder, pointing it up into the gently sloping hills that form the sides of the canyon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The final signature is approximately 300 meters up that incline.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mister Worf, accompany Data please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (uneasy) To find the head, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (amused) If you don't mind. Worf and Data climb up into the hills in pursuit of the final piece as Picard opens the jeep's hood and checks the engine. EXT.  KOLARUS III - HILLS - DAY Worf and Data climb as Data scans and indicates the direction:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ten meters... Worf pulls his phaser, ready.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think it unlikely you will need your phaser to recover the cranial unit.  Of course, it could bite you. Then they see it. Data's head.  Or the spitting image anyway.  Lying inert in the dust before them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The resemblance is... striking. Then the head's eyes suddenly pop open.  It looks up at them with a sort of blank, childlike wonder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why am I looking at me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are not looking at yourself. You are looking at me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking at Worf) You do not look like me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to head) I would like to pick you up now. May I do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Worf) You have a pretty shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. Data gently picks up the head.  Looks at it.  The two identical faces gaze at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fascinating... Then BLAM! -- a boulder near them explodes.  Worf and Data spin to see... A nomadic tribe of desert ALIENS swarming toward them firing primitive plasma weapons -- Data and Worf race back down the canyon, toward the jeep -- some open-field running and a bit of phaser action -- Worf firing to distract and slow the aliens, not kill them -- through all of this the head is chattering away blandly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have two arms and ten fingers. Do you know where my arms are?  I cannot see where we are going. Where are we going? (Etc... like Threepio in "Empire" when he's strapped to Chewbacca's back.) The action continues.  Then Data finds himself almost surrounded -- DATA Commander! Worf turns -- Data throws the head to Worf like a football, a perfect spiral -- the head is still chattering away -- Worf catches it -- WORF STOP TALKING! The head abruptly stops talking. Data, hands free now, quickly incapacitates the aliens around him with a dazzling demonstration of his superior strength and agility. Meanwhile, Worf tucks the head under his arm and sprints like a master running back -- evading aliens and occasionally firing his phaser -- They are closer to the jeep now -- but they are in trouble -- the swarm of aliens almost overtaking them -- ! When a thundering BLAST sends up a shower of debris, stopping the aliens -- Picard is standing in the rear of the jeep, firing the phaser canon. Data and Worf climb into the jeep as Picard leaps into the front seat and roars off -- INT./ EXT.  JEEP - KOLARUS III - FOLLOWING Worf, standing at the phaser canon, quickly hands the head to Data in the front seat:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you wouldn't mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. The head looks up at Picard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have a shiny head. Picard glances at the head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is very observant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can see that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain! Picard turns to see that they are being pursued!  The aliens are racing after them in crude desert-terrain vehicles -- PICARD (to Data) Shall we try some "unsafe velocities?" He floors it -- racing across the desert landscape. Worf fires the mounted phaser canon -- blasting away at the aliens, not killing them, just stopping them -- a few dramatic crashes as the alien vehicles overturn -- Meanwhile:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Picard) You have a red shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to head) This is not an appropriate time for a conversation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because the captain has to concentrate on piloting the vehicle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, sir. They continue to speed over the landscape -- bouncing and flying over natural rises in the terrain -- trying to evade their pursuers -- Picard puts the pedal to the metal and races through the alien vehicles -- weaving in and out, avoiding their fire -- Worf blasts away with the phaser cannon -- an exhilarating adventure -- Finally they are within sight of the Argo -- but they see it is surrounded by more of the aliens!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mister Data.  Let's make like the wind. Data punches some buttons on a dashboard console -- and the Argo LIFTS OFF by remote control -- Data uses the console to swing the Argo around and lower the rear cargo doors -- it hovers over the surface -- Picard floors the jeep -- using a natural rise in the terrain as a ramp -- the jeep FLIES THROUGH THE AIR -- over the aliens -- and into the cargo bay -- INT.  ARGO - CARGO BAY - FOLLOWING Picard slams on the brakes -- the jeep screeches to a stop as the doors shut and the Argo shoots into the air. Picard climbs from the jeep.  He nonchalantly rubs a bit of dirt from the hood and then disappears into the main cabin. Data and Worf remain in the jeep for a beat, stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiles) He must have Klingon blood. INT.  ENTERPRISE - ENGINEERING LAB - DAY Beverly gazes at the android head.  It gazes back at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you have nicer eyes. We pull back to reveal she is speaking to Data.  Data stands with Picard, Riker and Geordi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our eyes are identical, Doctor. The android is in a framework rig that holds the various body parts in place.  The parts are not yet assembled
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Geordi?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (at work analyzing the torso section) Well, he seems to have the same internal mechanics as Data but not as much positronic development. The neural pathways aren't nearly as sophisticated.  I'd say he's a prototype.  Something Dr. Soong created before Data.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to head) Do you have a name, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am the B-9.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be-nign.  Dr. Soong's penchant for whimsical names seems to have no end.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Riker) You have a fuzzy face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (trying to ignore the head) Keep me informed, Number One, and, please, put him back together. He goes.  Geordi and Data begin to reassemble the B-9 piece by piece like the Tin Man as:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you tell me how you came to be on the planet where we found you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (blandly) I was taken from my homeworld by people called the "PakJeds." They are fat.  They traded me to a ship belonging to the "Bolians." The "Bolians" are blue.  They put me in a seat and asked me questions. Then they were attacked by another ship... Time passes... And still the B-9 is yammering blandly away.  He is more fully assembled   By this time Beverly is thoroughly bored.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then people called the Delviciansans picked me up.  They have long teeth.  They asked if I do anything to help them.  I told them I could do whatever they wanted.  They asked me to clean out the matrix manifolds.  I told them I did not know what an Matrix manifold looks like.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me.  I have some diagnostics to run on some medical scanner things. She quickly exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And after they showed me the "engine manifolds." Then they showed me something called a "plasma mop" Time passes... And still the B-9 is yammering away.  He is almost completely assembled by now.  Riker is bored out of his mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... then the "Cardassians" put me into something called a "garbage chute" and I went out into space again -- WORF (V.O.) (ON COMM) Worf to Commander Riker.  I have the tactical manifests ready, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (quickly tapping his comm badge) Worf!  Wonderful!  I'll be right there!... (he stands) Duty calls, gentlemen.  Carry on. He escapes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuzzy face is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, please continue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was in space for a long time. Then a ship belonging to the "Talosians" picked me up.  They asked me where I came from.  I told them people called the "Pakleds" took me from my homeworld.  They are fat... Geordi groans. Time passes... And still the B-9 is yammering away.  By this time Geordi is slumped in a chair and only Data is listening.  The B-9 is fully assembled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I opened my eyes and saw you. A beat.  The B-9 is finally done with his tale...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know who I am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  My name is Data... I am your brother. INT.  ENTERPRISE - CREW LOUNGE - NIGHT Riker and Deanna are having dinner with Worf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Worf) ... and after the ceremony on Betazed, three entire weeks for our honeymoon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're going sailing on the Opal Sea.  We've booked an old-fashioned solar catamaran.  Just us and the sun and the waves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It seems a very... soft honeymoon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (amused) It's meant to be relaxing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Klingon honeymoon begins with the Kholamar desert march where the couple bonds in endurance trials. If they survive the challenge they move on to the Fire Caves of Fek'lhr to face the demons of Gre'thor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that sounds relaxing too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is... invigorating. They see Data enter the lounge, carefully leading the B-9.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So they've got him up and running.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a very unusual android
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiles) Runs in the family. They watch as Data leads the B-9 to a table.  Data instructs him to sit.  The B-9 sits and stares forward placidly.  Data shows him how use a napkin. A note of concern passes over Deanna's face as she watches Data and the B-9. There is something strangely poignant in the twin androids. One a bundle of curiosity and intelligence; the other somewhat like a slow, simple child. INT.  ENTERPRISE - READY ROOM - NIGHT Picard is at his replicator unit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Earl Grey, hot. A cup of tea appears.  He takes it as the door chime sounds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come. (Deanna enters) Counselor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have a moment, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course, sit down. He sits at his desk  She sits across from him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's about Data  I've watched him with the B-9 and I'm troubled. Data's desire for a "family" is very strong.  I'm afraid he may be investing too much in the B-9.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're speaking of emotional investment?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The B-9 is like a slow child, sir. And Data, in his own way, has assumed the position of a parent or guardian.  I'm afraid he has expectations based on his own experiences.  He'll be disappointed when the B-9 cannot meet those expectations.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As much as we care for him, Deanna... we have to remember that Data isn't capable of disappointment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't believe that, sir.  We've shared many disappointing journeys. A quiet beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to miss you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I you. They are interrupted by a comm signal:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain, you have an Alpha Priority communication from Starfleet Command.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Acknowledged... (Deanna stands) ... I'll talk to Data
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, sir. She goes.  Picard activates his desktop viewscreen. ADMIRAL KATHRYN JANEWAY appears on Picard's monitor.  Janeway is the former captain of Voyager.  Her new rank fits her well, she has lost none of her dry humor and down-to-earth charm which made her a household name and beloved cult figure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Admiral Janeway.  Good to see you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jean Luc... How'd you like a trip to Romulus?  All expenses paid?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiles) With or without the rest of the fleet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A diplomatic mission.  We've been invited, believe it or not.  Seems there's been some kind of internal political shakeup.  The new Praetor, someone called Shinzon, has requested a Federation envoy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: New Praetor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's more... as always.  He's Reman. (Picard is surprised) Believe me, we don't understand it either.  You're the closest ship so I want you to high tail it over there and hear what he has to say. Get the lay of the land, If the Empire becomes unstable, it could mean trouble for the entire quadrant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Understood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're sending you all the intelligence we have, but it's not much.  I don't need to tell you to watch your back, Jean Luc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not with the Romulans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiles wryly) The Son'a, the Borg, the Romulans, the evil Soran and that pesky Nexus.  You seem to get all the easy assignments!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just lucky, Admiral.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's hope that luck holds. Janeway out. The transmission ends. Picard sits for a moment, intrigued.  Then he goes to the bridge INT.  ENTERPRISE - BRIDGE - FOLLOWING Picard goes to his command chair:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Helm) Lay in a new course... Take us to Romulus.  Warp eight. The crew is shocked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aye aye, sir.  Course plotted and laid in...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Romulus?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm afraid the Opal Sea will have to wait, Number One... Engage. EXT.  ENTERPRISE - SPACE And the Enterprise jumps to high warp -- disappearing in a flash of dazzling light.  Yes! INT.  ENTERPRISE - OBSERVATION LOUNGE - DAY Data conducts a briefing for the senior officers.  Monitors currently show an image of Romulus and Remus in orbit around their sun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As you can see the habitable half of Remus is always in darkness because, like Mercury, one side always faces the sun.  Due to the extreme temperatures on that half of their world, the Remans live on the dark side of the planet. Various grainy and unclear new images appear to illustrate Data's words:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Almost nothing is known about the Reman homeworld, although intelligence scans have proven the existence of dilithium mining and heavy weapons construction. Very obscure images of Remans appear, the crew can barely make out the monstrous figures:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Remans themselves are considered an undesirable caste in the hierarchy of the Empire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But they also have the reputation of being formidable warriors.  In the Dominion War, Reman forces were used as assault troops in the most violent encounters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (grim) Cannon fodder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then how did a Reman get to be Praetor?  I don't get it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to assume he had Romulan collaborators.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A coup d'etat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Praetor's power has always been the Romulan fleet.  They must be behind him. Picard considers this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Data) What have you learned about Shinzon? The images end.  There are no images of Shinzon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Starfleet intelligence was only able to provide a partial account of his military record.  We can infer he is relatively young and a capable commander.  He fought seventeen major engagements in the war.  All successful.  Beyond that, we know nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... it seems we're truly sailing into the unknown.  Keep at it.  Anything you can give me would be appreciated.  Dismissed. The meeting breaks up. INT.  ENTERPRISE - ENGINEERING LAB - DAY The B-9 stares placidly forward. We pull back and discover that computer conduits connect the B-9's head to Data's head.  Geordi monitors the connection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At present he serves no useful function.  Dr. Soong created us to become active and useful members of society.  I do not believe he would have wanted the B-9 to live out his life in his present state.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't believe the Captain went along with a memory download.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain Picard agrees that the B-9 was probably designed with the same self-actualization parameters as myself.  If my memory engrams are successfully integrated into his positronic matrix, he should have all my abilities.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'd have all your memories too. You feel comfortable with that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I feel nothing, Geordi.  It is my belief that with my memory engrams he will be able to function as a more complete individual.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An individual more like you, you mean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe he's not supposed to be like you.  Maybe he's supposed to be just like he is. Geordi completes his work
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay... we're done. Geordi removes the computer connections from between their heads.  He carefully closes the panel in Data's head as:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to B-9) Do you know where you are?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am in a room with lights. He looks blankly at the console lights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you remember our father?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Data glances to Geordi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know the name of the Captain of this vessel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that your final answer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to B-9) Do you know my name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have a soft voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gently) Data, he's assimilating a lot of programming.  Remember, he's a prototype, a lot less sophisticated than you are.  We just don't know if his matrix will be able to adapt.  Or if he'll be able to retain anything.  We should give him some time. Data has been studying some circuitry in the B-9's neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What purpose does this serve?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (also examining circuitry) It seems to be a redundant memory port.  Maybe it's for provisional memory storage in case his neural pathways overload?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Soong must have found it unnecessary in later versions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's possible the extra memory port is interfering with the engram processing.  Mind if I keep him here and run some diagnostics?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I do not mind. Data looks at the B-9 with a sort of sadness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I believe he will prove incapable of performing higher functions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't give up hope, Data.  I know, I know, you're not capable of hope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking at B-9) I am not. Data stands.  The B-9 stands to follow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, remain with Commander La Forge. He is going to try to make you well. The B-9 sits.  Data goes.  Geordi watches him go. EXT.  ENTERPRISE - OVER ROMULUS - SPACE The Enterprise is in orbit around Romulus.  Remus can be seen in the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain's Log.  Stardate 47844.9. The Enterprise has arrived at Romulus and is waiting at the designated coordinates.  All our hails have gone unanswered.  We've been waiting for seventeen hours. INT.  ENTERPRISE - BRIDGE - FOLLOWING The crew is tense.  Silence. Worf, at tactical, slowly stretches his neck.  Trying to release the tension.  It cracks.  Deanna jumps a bit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't they answer our hails?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's an old psychological strategy, Number One.  To put him in a position of dominance and make us uneasy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's working.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Deanna) Counselor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're out there, sir. Picard stands and walks to the viewscreen.  He gazes at Romulus below and the black infinity of space beyond. They're out there, Waiting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir,  I recommend we raise shields.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not yet, Mister Worf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain, with all due respect to diplomatic protocols -- the Federation Council's not sitting out here, we are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Patience.  Diplomacy is a very exacting occupation.  We can wait.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain... And on the viewscreen. Shinzon's magnificent Reman Warbird, the SCIMITAR, decloaks directly before the Enterprise. EXT.  OVER ROMULUS - SPACE Our first sight of this incredible ship is absolutely breathtaking. Shinzon's vessel combines the clean lines of the traditional Romulan Warbird with unique weaponry and styling.  It is huge, easily twice as large as the Enterprise.  And it is aggressive.  Awesome in its power. INT.  ENTERPRISE - BRIDGE - FOLLOWING The crew gapes at the huge ship on the viewscreen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (slowly rising from his chair) My God...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (tense) Should I raise shields?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain -- !
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (firm) Tactical analysis, Mister Worf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (quickly analyzing tactical display) Fifty-two disruptor banks, twenty- seven photon torpedo bays, primary and secondary phased shields.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's not out for a pleasure cruise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (grim) She's a predator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're being hailed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On screen. And the image on the viewscreen transforms to: Shinzon's Viceroy. He stands on the Scimitar's bridge.  The bridge is as unique as the rest of Shinzon's ship.  Instead of the usual mechanical clutter, this bridge is designed with an almost Asian simplicity.  Like the rest of Reman design, it is spare and elegant. Since the Remans are more comfortable in the darkness, most of the light comes from the three steadily pulsing warp core relays which dramatically soar up through the floor of the bridge. The crew gazes at the bridge and the monstrous features of the viceroy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enterprise.  We are the Reman Warbird Scimitar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Praetor Shinzon, I'm pleased to -- VICEROY (ON VIEWSCREEN) I am not Shinzon.  I am his Viceroy.  We are sending transport coordinates. The transmission ends abruptly.  The Scimitar reappears on the viewscreen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not very chatty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Away team.  Transporter room four. Picard, Riker, Deanna, Worf and Data head toward the turbolift, energized now that the endless waiting is over. INT.  SCIMITAR - OBSERVATION LOUNGE - NIGHT The away team materializes in the most striking location on Shinzon's ship: a large observation lounge. It is a huge, empty chamber.  No furniture.  A simple Reman mat on the floor is the only decoration.  At the very top of the room there is a large, etched glass dome. It is very dark. They turn when Shinzon speaks from the shadows:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope you'll forgive the darkness... we're not comfortable in the light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Praetor Shinzon? Shinzon moves toward them a bit, becoming slightly more illuminated, the low light shining off his golden hair. The crew cannot see him clearly in the dim light but it is evident he is human.  Assuming that he was Reman, they're surprised by this realization. Shinzon just stares at Picard through the darkness for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain Picard... Jean Luc Picard... I don't mean to stare, it's just -- well, you can't imagine how long I've been waiting for this moment.  I always imagined you taller, isn't that odd? (to Data) You may scan me without subterfuge, Commander Data. Data scans him with a tricorder as:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you're not as we imagined you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are human.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Commander Worf. (he speaks in Klingon) I greet you as a valiant warrior... and as my brother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (terse, in Klingon) I'll save my greetings for a better brother. Shinzon laughs, maniacally.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why have you asked for our presence here? Shinzon does not answer.  He is staring deeply at Deanna, moans softly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Praetor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (quietly) I've never met a human woman. He slowly moves toward her, still hidden in the shadows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm only half human.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deanna Troi of Betazed.  Empathic and telepathic abilities, ship's counselor.  All of this I knew... But I didn't know you were so beautiful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You seem very familiar with our personnel. Shinzon moves even closer to Deanna, not taking his eyes from her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am, Commander Riker... (to Deanna) ... May I touch your hair?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (firm) Praetor, we've come to Romulus on a matter we were -- assured was of great importance.  If you have anything to say to us as representatives of the Federation, I suggest you do so now. Shinzon continues to stare at Deanna.  It is strangely seductive.  Almost disquieting in its intensity.  Deanna handles it with grace, her level gaze never leaving his.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (softly) On the world I come from there's no light.  No sun.  Beauty isn't important.  I see now there's a world elsewhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Praetor Shinzon.  We're not here to discuss your lack of a social life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (turning back to Picard) Yes, I'm sorry, Captain. (he smiles) There's so much we have to talk about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would be interested to know what we are talking about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unity, Captain!  Tearing down the walls between us to recognize we are one people.  Federation and Romulan.  Human and Vulcan and Klingon and Reman.  I'm speaking of the thing that makes us the same. We want peace. Picard and the others are stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to end the centuries of mistrust.  I want to be your ally, not your enemy.  As a first step I propose we eliminate the Neutral Zone and begin a free and open exchange of goods and ideas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the Senate supports you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (dry) I have dissolved the Senate. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right now, you're thinking this all sounds too good to be true?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you're wondering why the Scimitar is so well armed.  Is this the ship of a peacemaker?  Or a predator? (Picard is startled at Shinzon's choice of words) ... But you're also thinking the chance for peace is too promising to ignore.  Above all, you're trying to decide if you can trust me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then perhaps the time has come to add some illumination to our discussion.  Computer, raise lighting four levels. Lights shoot up around the room. For the first time the crew can see Shinzon clearly.  Picard actually gasps when he sees Shinzon's face.  The rest of the crew doesn't understand his reaction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Allow me to tell you a story that I hope will clarify my position. When I was very young I was stricken with an odd disease.  I developed a hyper-sensitivity to sound.  The slightest whisper caused me agony... Picard watches him carefully.  Wary and strangely intense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one knew what to do.  Finally I was taken to a doctor who had some experience with Terran illnesses and I was finally diagnosed with Shalaft's syndrome.  Do you know of it, Captain?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know I do. The crew is dumbfounded at Picard's unusual reaction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then you know it's a very rare syndrome.  Genetic.  All the male members of my family had it. Eventually I was treated.  Now I can hear as well as you can, Captain. He steps toward Picard who holds his ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can see as well as you can.  I can feel everything you feel. (He stops right before Picard) In fact, I feel exactly what you feel.  Don't I, Jean Luc? Picard stares at him with a mixture of realization and curiosity.  It is as if Picard is looking into a strange, remembered mirror: Shinzon's face is nearly identical to his at that age.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you trust me now? A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need to talk, just you and I.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come to dinner on Romulus tomorrow. Just the two of us.  Or just the one of us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know I need to verify this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. The crew is utterly confused.  Their confusion turns to outright shock when Shinzon calmly pulls out a Reman knife and cuts his arm, drawing a little blood.  He hands the knife to Data.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tomorrow then, Captain.  We have so much to discuss. Picard touches his communicator pin:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picard to Enterprise.  Five to beam out. They dematerialize, the shimmering glow illuminating Shinzon's features.  Picard's eyes never leave Shinzon as the transporter effect ripples around him. INT.  ENTERPRISE - SICKBAY - DAY Beverly stands with Picard, Riker and Deanna.  The Reman knife is under a protonmicroscope and other medical readouts and analysis are visible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no doubt, Captain.  Right down to your regressive strain of Shalaft's Syndrome.  He's a clone. A beat as the confirmation sinks in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When was he... created?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About twenty-five years ago.  They probably used a hair follicle or skin cell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (touching head) I think a skin cell's the more likely of the two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Believe me, Number One; I'm going to find out.  Contact Starfleet Command and inform them of the situation.  I need to know where the hell he came from.  Deanna. He goes, Deanna following. INT.  ENTERPRISE - CORRIDOR - FOLLOWING DEANNA I would say he's been trained to resist telepathy.  What I could sense of his emotions were erratic, very hard to follow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he sincere about wanting peace?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. (she stops him) Sir, the strongest sense I had was that he's more than curious about you.  He very much wants to know you. (she looks at him deeply) The same way you want to know him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How could I not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain, don't assume he's anything like you are.  You should resist the urge to think you know him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I not only know him, Deanna, I am him... and he is me! He goes. INT.  ENTERPRISE - RIKER AND DEANNA'S CABIN - NIGHT Riker is hard at work over a series of padds.  He has been working for hours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will, you need to rest. (he continues to work) As ship's counselor, I'm recommending you get me sleep. Riker tosses a padd on the desk.  Rubs his eyes.  Looks up her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some honeymoon. She smiles and goes to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have time. (she kisses him) Come to bed. She pulls him up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Imzadi, what am I going to do with you? They kiss deeply.  She pulls him across the room and they fall into the bed. It is passionate, erotic.  Her arms undulate around him sensually... her fingers snake through his hair, but something is wrong.  Riker's hair is now blond. She starts back, her eyes growing wide. Riker is gone.  She is now embracing Shinzon!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Imzadi.  This is so good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! He caresses her face...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He can never know you as I know you... He can never touch you as I touch you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This isn't real.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you feel my hands... are they real?  Can you feel my lips, my loins? He kisses her neck -- but when he raises his head again.  It is the monstrous Viceroy!  Holding her.  Caressing her.  She is frozen in horror.  But is it the Viceroy at all? Shinzon's voice seems to come from the Viceroy's lips:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm with you, Imzadi... And then it is Shinzon again, kissing her:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll always be with you now.  Now and forever...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sick bastard! She pushes him away...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deanna?!  What's with the name calling? It is Riker.  She stares at him, then clings to him desperately. EXT.  ROMULAN SENATE - DAY The Byzantine splendors of the Senate loom before us. INT.  ROMULAN SENATE CHAMBER - DAY Heavy drapes are drawn against any hint of the sun.  Shinzon is in conference with the Romulan Commanders and Senator Tal'Aura.  Commander Donatra watches him closely. Commander Suran is angry, pacing.  Shinzon stands.  His Viceroy lurks in a corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... then I don't understand the reason for the delay!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have to understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And bringing the Enterprise here?! What possible purpose could that serve?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a purpose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then perhaps you will enlighten us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (snaps) Silence, Romulan! A tense beat.  Shinzon regains his composure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must learn patience, Commander. Do you know where I learned it?  In the dilithium mines of Remus. Spend eighteen hours every day under the lash of a Romulan guard's whip and you'll soon understand patience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (carefully bows his head) Praetor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now go.  I have some personal business. Suran and the others go. Donatra turns just as she is leaving the chamber, she sees the Viceroy going to Shinzon.  And then do something odd. The Viceroy puts his hand on Shinzon's chest, leans very close and talks to him quietly.  This is an ancient form of Reman telepathic medical diagnosis. This strange sight perplexes Donatra.  The doors close, blocking her view... INT.  SENATE - CORRIDOR - FOLLOWING We go with Donatra and the other Romulans.  Donatra speaks quietly to Suran:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long before he has us in the dilithium mines? INT.  ENTERPRISE - DATA'S CABIN - DAY The B-9 sits placidly in a chair, staring forward. Then, as if a switch was thrown, he moves.  He quickly rises and goes to a computer console.  He efficiently starts punching in commands at an amazing velocity. INT.  ROMULAN SENATE CHAMBER - NIGHT Picard and Shinzon sit alone in a corner of the sweeping Senate chamber.  The remains of dinner before them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And when I was ready they were going to replace you with me, an exact biological duplicate.  Put a Romulan agent at the heart of Starfleet to influence your command structure.  It was a bold plan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As happens so frequently here on Romulus, a new government came to power.  They decided to abandon the plan -- frankly, I think they were afraid I'd be discovered and it would lead to war.  They weren't ready for that. Picard pours a glass of Romulan ale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Romulan ale -- I'm surprised.  I can't stand it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiles) You'll acquire a taste for it. A beat.  They look at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not quite the face you remember.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not quite.  I envy the hairline.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A lifetime of violence will do that.  My nose was broken four times.  And my jaw... But so much is the same.  The eyes, you recognize the eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  The eyes have it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our eyes reflect our lives, don't they?  Yours are so confident.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did you end up on Remus?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They sent me there to die.  How could a mere human survive the dilithium mines?  It was... (he can't find the words) ... I was a slave.  And a monster. The only thing the Romulan guards hated more than the Remans was me. But one man took pity on me: the man who became my Viceroy.  He taught me how to survive.  And in that dark place, where there was nothing of myself, I found my Reman brothers.  They showed me the only kindness I ever knew. A beat.  He glances to the Romulan crest on the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For thousands of years the Romulan Senate has met in this chamber and dictated the fate of its sister- planet... But the time has come for us to live as equals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're doing this to liberate the Remans?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No race should be a slave to another. Picard is impressed with Shinzon's quiet words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't trust me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have no reason to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course you do.  If you had lived my life and experienced the suffering of my people... you'd be sitting where I am now.  At least I hope you would.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And if you had lived my life you would understand that there is a great responsibility in representing the Federation.  I can't let my personal feelings unduly influence my decisions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All I have is my personal feelings. I wasn't raised with the ideals of the Federation.  But I'm trying to understand them now.  To live up to them   To live up to you. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to know where I come from. The Remans gave me a future.  You can tell me about my past.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's so much, and so much of it is dull...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Were we always explorers? PlCARD No.  I was the first Picard to leave Earth.  It caused quite a stir, In fact.  But I had spent my whole life...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (finishing the sentence) Looking up at the stars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you dreamed about what was up there.  About...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (finishing the sentence) New worlds. A beat. They both reach for a carafe of water at the exact same instant.  Stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After you, Praetor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiles) Age before rank, Jean Luc. Picard smiles, pours a glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I'm not as tall as you expected?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I always hoped I would hit two meters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With a full head of hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiles) There is that. A quiet beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shinzon... I'm trying to believe you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If there's one ideal the Federation holds most dear it's that all men, all races, can be united.  From the first time the Vulcans came to Earth we've sought a future of peace.  Nothing would make me more proud than to take your hand in friendship.  In time.  When trust has been earned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm honored to think I might someday speak with such eloquence. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In time, Jean Luc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In time. INT.  SENATE CHAMBER - LATER Picard is gone.  Shinzon sits, thinking.  His Viceroy enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a mistake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's gentler than I thought.  And he has a sense of humor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (stern) Don't forget our mission, Shinzon. We should act.  Now.  Time is running out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (snaps) My time.  I'll spend it how I choose. A tense beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll return to the Scimitar. Prepare yourself for the bonding. INT.  ENTERPRISE  BRIDGE - NIGHT Picard emerges from the turbolift.  Data, Worf and Geordi wait at the bridge engineering station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, we've had an unauthorized access into the main computer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who was it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's going to take some time to find out -- the data stream was rerouted through substations all over the ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What programs were accessed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what I don't get -- it's mostly basic stellar cartography: star charts; communications protocols; some uplinks from colony tracking stations.  It's not even restricted material.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Worf) Set up a security program to detect any unusual data stream rerouting. If it happens again, we want to be ready.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (grim) There's something else.  I was reviewing the sensor logs... (he refers to some readouts on his console) When the Scimitar decloaked there was a momentary spike in the tertiary EM band -- there -- You're not going to believe this but it's Thalaron. Picard is shocked. INT.  SICKBAY - NIGHT Picard stands, concerned, with Beverly, Geordi and Data. Monitors showing Thalaron research are visible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I thought Thalaron radiation was theoretical.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which is why our initial scans didn't pick it up.  But he's got it, Captain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As I remember, Thalaron research was banned in the Federation because of its bioqenic properties.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It has the ability to consume organic material at the subatomic level.  I can't overestimate the danger of Thalaron radiation, Jean Luc.  A microscopic amount could kill every living thing on this ship in a matter of seconds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Understood.  Keep on it.  I need to know what he has and how to neutralize any threat.  Give me options. Picard goes.  Data thinks for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doctor, will you excuse us for a moment?  Geordi, please come with me. He and Geordi head out.  Beverly returns to some medical displays showing Thalaron research, her expression deeply concerned. INT.  ENTERPRISE - PICARD'S CABIN - NIGHT Picard is sitting at his desk, flipping through an old photo album.  He stops and stares at one of the pictures deeply troubled.  We finally see the photo: Young Jean Luc Picard. A serious, unsmiling cadet at Starfleet Academy.  The face before him bears a disturbing resemblance to Shinzon. The door comm chirps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come... (Beverly enters) ... Beverly, come in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're working late. She sits, notes the picture of Young Jean Luc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remember him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was a bit proud as I recall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was a damn fool.  Selfish and ambitious.  Very much in need of seasoning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turned out all right. He rises, goes to a window, gazes at the Scimitar in the distance.  A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I so wanted to believe Shinzon. But the Thalaron radiation can't be explained away.  Whatever he's after, it's not peace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he very much like you were?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Data interrupts on comm:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Data to Captain Picard.  Geordi and I have identified the source of the unauthorized computer access.  And, I believe, we have also discovered an opportunity to gain a tactical advantage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to comm) On my way...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (stands) Jean Luc -- whatever you were -- right now you're the man you've made yourself.  He's someone else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wish I could believe that, Doctor. He goes. INT.  ENTERPRISE - TURBOLIFT - MORNING Deanna is alone on the turbolift.  Then a voice makes her spin:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Imzadi... Shinzon stands across from her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (moving to her) Very logical, Deanna... But your heart doesn't constrain itself to mere logic. (he caresses her) ... Your heart longs to discover me.  To know me... (he kisses her) ... To leave all of this behind and be with me. He pushes her against the wall, with passion and almost violence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can feel your desire, Deanna... She forces herself to concentrate... to resist telepathically... it is a mighty effort... this Romulan is hot.  And the world around her appears to be changing... bending... And she is momentarily in a cabin on the Scimitar.  Although entirely a telepathic experience, it is as if she has actually traveled. She sees Shinzon kneeling over a small flame, she realizes she is looking through the Viceroy's eyes. On the Scimitar, Shinzon looks up at the Viceroy/Deanna:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can feel your hunger to know the Reman ways... the old ways. Then the world changes again... Deanna is on the turbolift.  Shinzon is pressed against her, whispering:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't fear what you desire... She forces him away from her and -- She is alone.  She sinks to her knees.  Overcome with emotion. INT.  SCIMITAR - VICEROY'S CABIN - FOLLOWING The Viceroy, in a kind of trace, kneels before a small flame. Shinzon kneels across from him.  The Viceroy raises his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bond is broken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Find her again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No -- this is wasting time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do as I tell you! A Reman officer interrupts on comm:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Praetor, we've received the transponder signal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to comm) On my way. He begins to go -- but suddenly stops, a wave of illness overtaking him. The Viceroy puts his hand on Shinzon's chest.  A strange moment as the Viceroy shuts his eyes and feels Shinzon's chest.  His mind... probing. Then the Viceroy looks up at him, grim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's accelerating.  You have no more time for games.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have the doctors prepare.  I'll be on the bridge. He goes. INT.  SCIMITAR - BRIDGE - DAY Shinzon stands with some REMAN ENGINEERS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Transport. An Engineer activates a transporter and the B-9 materializes!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Welcome home. (to Engineers) Begin the download. Reman engineers go to the B-9 and open the panel in his neck, begin connecting computer conduits to the extra memory port we saw earlier. (Note: Although the audience will not know it yet, this is actually Data pretending to be the B-9.) Shinzon goes to a replicator unit and orders:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tea, hot. A cup of tea appears.  He takes it and sips as he watches his Engineers connecting the conduits to the B-9. INT.  ENTERPRISE - SICKBAY - DAY Beverly is scanning Deanna.  Picard and Riker watch, concerned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aside from slightly elevated adrenalin and serotonin levels, you're completely normal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gently) Can you describe it, Deanna? She looks at Picard, tears in her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was... a violation. Riker takes her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (with difficulty) Shinzon's Viceroy seems to have the ability to reach into my thoughts. I've become a liability... I request to be relieved of my duties.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Permission denied.  If you can possibly endure any more of these assaults.  I need you at my side. Now more than ever I... But before the words are out of his mouth... he begins to dematerialize!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to comm) Worf!  Raise Shields ! But Picard is gone. EXT.  OVER ROMULUS - SPACE The Scimitar cloaks. INT.  SCIMITAR - BRIG - NIGHT Picard stands in the Reman brig.  His communicator pin has been removed. Beyond the security force field a ghoulish medical apparatus is being prepared.  A metal chair with laser scalpels, IV tubes and hyposprays connected to it.  Reman doctors work over the mysterious chair. Shinzon enters with the B-9 following.  Shinzon stands on the other side of the force field. Picard notices something immediately.  Tiny veins are now visible on Shinzon's face; the faintest sign of an intricate spider-web pattern of pale blue veins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Jean Luc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why am I here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was lonely... (he realizes Picard is staring at the veins on his face) Perhaps I'm not aging as well as you did. He nods to a guard.  The guard deactivates the force field. A Reman doctor enters and raises a hypospray toward Picard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (resists) What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need a sample of your blood. What do your Borg friends say? Resistance is futile. (maniacal laugh) The Doctor takes a quick sample of Picard's blood as Picard glances to the B-9.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  The bait you couldn't refuse. I learned there might be an existing prototype from a Cardassian historian, then went to a great deal of trouble to find it and scatter it about on Kolarus
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  I knew it would pique your curiosity and conveniently make the Enterprise the closest ship to Romulus when I contacted Starfleet. The Reman doctor leaves the cell.  The force field is reactivated.  The doctor goes to the mysterious medical apparatus and analyzes Picard's blood.  As:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All of this so you could capture me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be so vain.  After we found it, we made a few modifications. An extra memory port, a hidden transponder.  Perhaps your eyes will be a bit less confident when you learn I've gained access to Starfleet's communications protocols.  I now know the location of your entire fleet... (to B-9) ... You may go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Out of my sight. The B-9 obediently leaves the room as:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe I'll train it to do little tricks for me like your robot does. Or maybe I'll snap its ugly head off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's this all about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's about destiny, Picard.  About a Reman outcast who -- PICARD You're not Reman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I'm not quite human.  So what am I?  What do you see? (he peers at Picard deeply) Do you see a life you might have led?  Lost youth never to be recaptured?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see a young man trying desperately to deny who he is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see an old man, set in his ways, afraid to live without a uniform to prop him up and a Starfleet regulation to tell him what to do. I see the man I will never be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I won't defend my life to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My life is meaningless as long as you're alive.  What am I while you exist?  A shadow?  An enigma?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (stern) If your issues are with me... This has nothing to do with my ship and nothing to do with the Federation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, but it does.  We will no longer bow like slaves before anyone.  Not the Romulans and not your mighty Federation.  We're a race bred for war.  For conquest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think about what you're doing, Shinzon.  Are you ready to plunge the entire quadrant into war to satisfy your own personal demons?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It amazes me how little you know yourself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm incapable of such an act, and so are you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think the facts speak for themselves.  The same noble Picard blood runs in our veins.  Had you lived my life, you'd be doing exactly as I am.  Look in the mirror, and see yourself. Shinzon looks at him deeply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Consider that, Captain.  I can think of no greater torment for you. He turns to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a mirror for you as well... Shinzon turns back to him. A beat.  Picard gazes at him evenly. Picard's probing gaze makes Shinzon a bit uneasy.  He glances to the ghoulish medical preparations.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not for long, Captain. (back to Picard) I'm afraid you won't survive to witness the victory of the echo over the voice. He goes. INT.  ENTERPRISE - BRIDGE - NIGHT The ship is on Red Alert.  Worf stands at tactical, muscles coiled, hungry for action.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No response to our hails. Geordi is hard at work at the Science station.  Riker stands over him:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (frustrated) His cloak is perfect... no tachyon emissions, no residual antiprotons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep at it, Geordi.  Find a way in. Beverly arrives on the bridge, urgent.  She carries a medical padd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will, I need to talk to you. INT.  SCIMITAR - BRIG - NIGHT Picard stands in his cell, peering at the edges of the security force field, trying to spot any weakness. Then the B-9 enters the brig, he holds a Reman disruptor weapon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Reman guard) I am to take the prisoner to the Praetor. The Reman Guard deactivates the force field.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you resist, I will incapacitate you. He leads Picard out. INT.  SCIMITAR - CORRIDORS - FOLLOWING The B-9 leads Picard through the dark corridors, holding the disruptor on him steadily.  All the Remans they pass glare at Picard with undisguised loathing. The Viceroy approaches.  Stops before them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to B-9) Where are you taking him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Praetor Shinzon wants him on the bridge. The Viceroy turns his malevolent gaze on Picard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, human... you've met your better self!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing to Counsellor Troi?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm preparing her for Shinzon... To sooth him as she soothes you.  To stand at his side as she does at yours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That will never happen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen to him, android.  Such a small and weak creature.  Yet he roars so valiantly... (he raises one taloned claw and puts a sharp fingernail on Picard's chest) It would take me but an instant to tear that valiant heart from your chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There'll be another after me.  And another after that.  You'll find we're a resilient species.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I look forward to the sport. (to the B-9, harshly) Take him. The B-9 prods Picard's back roughly with the disruptor. Picard grimaces in pain
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Move. The Viceroy continues away down the corridor.  The B-9 leads Picard along.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (whispers) Be careful of over-playing your part, Commander! And the audience now realizes it is Data pretending to be the B-9 and rejoices.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, sir.  I thought it added a touch of reality to the performance. They are silent as they pass a few Reman guards.  Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My mission was a success, sir.  I have discovered the source of the Thalaron radiation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good work.  The download?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He believes he has our communications protocols.  But they will give him inaccurate locations for all Starfleet vessels. Data assumes the B-9's posture again as they pass some some Reman Warriors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Move, puny human animal. They pass the Warriors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A bit less florid, Data.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aye, sir... This way. He leads Picard down the corridor. INT.  SCIMITAR - GENERATION CHAMBER - NIGHT Data leads Picard into a massive chamber that soars up like a cathedral.  It is the size of a small town. The whole, cavernous chamber pulses with glowing green light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This entire ship is, essentially, a flying Thalaron generator. (he points up) All its power relays lead to that device. High above them, at the very top of the chamber, is a gigantic version of the spider-weapon we saw kill all the Romulan Senators before.  It is breathtaking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A weapon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It would appear so. Data rotates his left hand and then slides it forward, exposing a hidden compartment in his wrist.  He removes a small, silver disc.  This is a cool new piece of Federation technology called an ETU.  (Emergency Transport Unit.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Geordi equipped me with the prototype for the Emergency Transport Unit.  I recommend you use it to return to the Enterprise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It'll only work for one of us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll find a way off together. Recommendations?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a shuttlebay 948 meters from our current location. Data inserts the ETU back into his wrist and they leave the chamber. INT.  SCIMITAR BRIDGE - NIGHT The Viceroy arrives on the bridge, stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Picard? Shinzon looks at him, confused. INT.  SCIMITAR - CORRIDORS - NIGHT Security alert klaxons suddenly begin to howl and harsh Reman commands are broadcast through the corridors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This way, sir! They sprint down the twisting, dark corridors -- Reman warriors suddenly appear before them! -- Data fires the disruptor as Picard launches himself into them -- A fight -- Picard uses a dazzlinq series of Starfleet hand- to-hand maneuvers -- he dramatically subdues the Remans. More Reman warriors appear down the corridor.  Picard grabs a disruptor. And instantly spins to fire a blazing disruptor.  A battle breaks out in the corridor -- the energy beams and explosions illuminating the violent fire fight in strobe-like bursts. They run to another corridor and finally arrive at the shuttlebay door -- it does not open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking at door security panel) It seems to have an encrypted security system. Reman warriors are closing in on them. Data tosses his disruptor to Picard -- Picard catches it and instantly spins and fires -- he uses both disruptors to fire down both ends of the corridor like a Western sheriff -- keeping the Remans at bay -- As Data uses both hands to punch numbers into the shuttlebay door security panel at an amazing rate -- PICARD Alacrity would be appreciated, Commander.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are trying to override the access codes.  Reman is really a most complex language with pictographs representing certain verb roots and -- PICARD While I find that fascinating, Data, we really need that Goddamned door open! The shuttlebay door slides open. Picard lays down a blistering barrage of cover fire as he and Data duck into the shuttlebay. INT.  SCIMITAR - SHUTTLEBAY - FOLLOWING When the door closes behind them, Picard turns and fires a disruptor blast -- sealing the door mechanism. They turn to face... A fleet of very small shuttles.  They are uniquely designed. Extremely compact and stream-lined.  A disruptor turret on each. They move toward one as:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: According to the ship's manifest they are Scorpion-class attack fliers. They quickly climb a Scorpion. INT.  SCORPION COCKPIT - SHUTTLEBAY - FOLLOWING The cockpit of the Scorpion is cramped.  Picard climbs into the pilot's position.  Data assumes the gunner's position. They see disruptor fire trying to burn through the door to the shuttlebay -- Picard powers up the Scorpion as:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (trying to figure out the controls) What do you imagine this is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Port thrusters, sir.  Would you like me to drive? Picard shoots him a look and presses some controls.  The Scorpion lifts off.  Hovers a few feet over the deck.  Picard elegantly swings it around toward the large shuttlebay external doors as:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you open the shuttlebay doors?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (working controls) Affirmative, sir.  Negative, sir. They have instigated security overrides and erected a force field around the external portals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well then... only one way to go. He swings the Scorpion around again so it is facing the doors they came through, the doors back into the ship. Data is dubious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you think this is a wise course of action?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're about to find out... Power up disruptors and fire on my mark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ready, Captain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fire! And the Scorpion's forward disruptors fire!  The doors into the ship explode!  Picard powers forward! INT.  SCIMITAR CORRIDORS - FOLLOWING And the Scorpion shoots into the corridor, past the stunned Remans.  Picard banks sharply -- careens off the far side of the corridor but keeps control. The Scorpion zooms down the corridor. INT.  SCORPION COCKPIT - SCIMITAR - FOLLOWING Picard is concentrating intensely -- it is like trying to control the world's fastest roller coaster. INT.  SCIMITAR - CORRIDORS - FOLLOWING The Scorpion banks around a corner --it zigs and zags through the ship at breakneck speed -- INT.  SCIMITAR - OBSERVATION LOUNGE - NIGHT The doors to the observation lounge EXPLODE in. The Scorpion SHOOTS into the room and up -- A disruptor blast SHATTERS the etched glass dome at the top of the room -- And the Scorpion ZOOMS triumphantly into space! EXT.  OVER ROMULUS - SPACE The Scorpion seems to appear from nowhere -- slicing through the cloak of invisibility around the Scimitar -- INT.  ENTERPRISE - BRIDGE - FOLLOWING The crew sees the Scorpion appear on the viewscreen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Worf!  Lock on transporters! INT.  SCIMITAR BRIDGE - FOLLOWING Shinzon sees the Scorpion as well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tractor beam!  Now! EXT.  OVER ROMULUS - SPACE But they are too late -- the Scorpion dematerializes -- INT.  ENTERPRISE - CARGO BAY - FOLLOWING And materializes in one of the Enterprise's cargo bays. Picard and Data climb out -- PICARD (to comm) Number One, emergency warp! EXT.  OVER ROMULUS - FOLLOWING The Enterprise dramatically powers forward and up -- rolling over in a great arc going into warp while still upside down. It disappears in a blaze of light.  Fade to... INT.  SCIMITAR - BRIDGE - NIGHT Shinzon sits in his command chair as the ship streaks through space.  He speaks on viewscreen with his Romulan collaborators.  His face is even more finely veined now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Enterprise is immaterial!  They won't make it back to Federation space.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (angry) This has gone far enough!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought we discussed patience, Commander.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And mine is wearing thin, young man!  We supported you because you promised action.  And yet you delay and you waste your time playing games with Picard while -- Shinzon stands and briskly pulls down his uniform tunic exactly as we've seen Picard do a thousand times.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Commander Suran, the games are over.  In two days the Federation will be crippled beyond repair. Does that satisfy you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (grim) For the moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (brutal) And when I return... you and I shall have a little talk about showing proper respect! INT.  ROMULAN SENATE - CHAMBER - FOLLOWING The viewscreen picture of Shinzon snaps out.  The Romulan sit for a silent beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does anyone in this room harbor any illusions about what he means by "showing proper respect"?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's happening to his face?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want opinions.  He is clearly out of his mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But can he complete his mission?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should he? They look at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you prepared to have your hands drenched in blood?  He'll show them no mercy.  And his sins will mark us all for generations.  Is that what you truly want, Romulans? A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you should consider that question now -- or else you may have a lifetime to think about it in the dilithium mines. She turns and stalks out. INT.  ENTERPRISE - READY ROOM - NIGHT Beverly sits with Picard and Riker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The more I studied his DNA the more confusing it got.  Finally I could only come to one conclusion... Shinzon was created with temporal
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sequencing.  He was designed so that at a certain point his aging process could be accelerated to reach your age more quickly, so he could replace you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But the Romulans abandoned the plan...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As a result the temporal sequencing was never activated.  Remember, he was supposed to replace you at nearly your current age.  He was engineered to skip thirty years of life.  But since the RNA sequencing was never activated, his cellular structure has started to break down.  He's dying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He wasn't designed to live a complete, human life span. PlCARD Can anything be done for him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not without a complete myelodysplastic infusion from the only donor with compatible DNA. But that would mean draining all your blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's why he went to all that trouble to capture you. PlCARD How long does he have?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't be sure but the rate of decay seems to be accelerating. Picard considers this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then he'll come for me as a donor. INT.  ENTERPRISE - DATA'S CABIN - NIGHT Data stands before the B-9. The B-9 has been deactivated, he stands lifeless and immobile.
